cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving very slowly west, then forecast to turn northwest and drift toward the middle Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Matagorda Bay, TX (between Port O’Connor and Freeport)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas TX to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island and portions of western Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely Monday night through Tuesday with a small chance (≤7%) of 50-kt gusts; gusts could approach hurricane strength if Beta strengthens near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible along Brazoria County coast, including the Freeport shipping channel, with large battering waves and coastal flooding at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain producing 5–10 inches with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood potential and operational delays on docks and road/rail approaches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, elevated seas in the approaches, possible minor river flooding backing up into port waterways.
